page.title: 04PLOCKTON CHURCH OF SCOTLAND.
page.content: IN 1824 PARLIAMENT DECIDED TO BUILD CHURCHES IN THE REMOTE AREAS OF THE { {HIGHLANDS.PLOCKTON CHURCH OF SCOTLAND} AND{BURIAL GROUND},ALONG WITH THE MANSE ACROSS THE ROAD,WERE BUILT TO A DESIGN BY THE FAMOUS SCOTS ENGINEER,{ {THOMAS TELFORD.}THE CHURCH IS STILL USED AND IS KEPT IN GOOD CONDITION.THE BURIAL GROUND IS ALMOST FULL.IT STANDS ABOUT 1m ABOVE THE STREET LEVEL SO THAT GRAVES COULD BE DUG TO THE CORRECT DEPTH IN THE SHALLOW SOIL. THE EARLIEST HEADSTONE IS{1834}AND THERE ARE A LOT OF CHILDREN'S GRAVES. MOST OF THE{SURNAMES}ON GRAVES ARE {MacKENZIE,MATHESON,LIVINGSTONE,STEWART {,MacDONALD AND MacLENNAN.}THESE ARE STILL LOCAL SURNAMES TODAY.THERE WAS A STRONG CONNECTION WITH THE SEA.{SHIP {OWNER,SHIPPING AGENT AND SEAMEN}ARE ALL BURIED THERE.PLOCKTON ALSO HAS A { {FREE}AND{FREE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH.
